p: Some studies noted failure of environmental infection control [ 32, 35, 39, 43]. Two of those studies were TB epidemics, and the investigation revealed that the case residents were exposed to insufficient room ventilation. An influenza outbreak in the summer was facilitated by a heating preventive measure that placed all the residents in one limited area [ 43]. The response to outbreaks also could influence the progress of outbreaks. Nine reports underlined early notification of outbreaks to public health authorities and implementation of control measures within 3 days of onset of the first case, which affected the attack rates and duration of the outbreaks [ 23, 29, 35, 41, 44, 46, 48â€“ 50].
